result.execSummary:
The defendant Louise Ann Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $50.00 per month, commencing November 1, 2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Louise Ann Stone in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:10 PM. Also called 15CF108 and 15CM108. State - resolved. Burns - resolved - 15CF62 - plead to count #1 and #2 as alleged - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: #1 - $300 fine plus costs, #2 - costs only, DRI #3, conditions include: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments that sell alcohol, 50 hours of community service, employment/school, no contact or affiliation with Tia Gilligan or Mickey Frank, take all meds as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed; 15CF105 - amend count #1 to misd theft PTAC contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and plead to count #2 as amended to misd. bail jumping, impose 9 months in county jail on each count - consecutive to each other, stayed, place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: costs only on each count and then the same conditions of probation on 15CF62; 15CM108 - plead to only count as alleged with court costs only. State and Stone agree. State - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response and no VIS. Court does not believe the defendant understands what is happening today. Recess to have attorney explain things more (2:16 PM). Recalled at 2:42 PM, Stone and Burns want to continue with plea agreement. 15CM108 - defendant pleads NC to only count; 15CF62 - pleads NC to count #1 and #2 as alleged, court DRI #3; 15CF105 - court amends count #1 to misd theft contrary to 943.02(1)(a) with PTAC modifier - reads new charge and penalty - pleads NC to amended count #1; court amends count #2 tp misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty - pleads NC to amended count #2. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it. Collaquey stopped due to statement be defendant regarding if this is the best deal that she can get, she will proceed. Court continues with collaquey after brief discussion with the defendant and the defendant wants to continue today. Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - 16 days of credit on 15CF105 and 6 days credit on 15CF62. State stipulats to jail credit. Stone makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF62 - count #1 - fine of $300 plus costs - pay thru probation on count #2, count #2withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: $300 fine plus costs, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain employment/school, 50 hours of community service, no contact with Tia Gilligan or Mickey Frank, take all meds as presribed, costs; 15CF105 - impose 9 months in FC jail - stayed, place on probation for 2 years with same conditions as 15CF62 with no additional community service, costs; #2 - 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to count #1, stayed, place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #1, with same conditions except no additional community service, costs; 15CM108 - costs only and pay at rate of $50.00/month commencing 10/1/15/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Louise Ann Stone in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Louise Ann Stone in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:14 AM. Also called 15CF105 and 15CF62. Stone has one complaint. Burns provided all three complaints in court so she has not gone over all of them with the defendant. 15CF62 - Court previously read the defendant those charges and penalties and set cash bond at $1000.00. 15CM108 - cash bond was set previously but has not appeared on it. 15CF105 - no bond has been set. Court reads charges and penalties for 15CM108 and 15CF105. State provides court officer with complaints for the defendant. Stone understands charges and penalties. Stone must provide a DNA sample on 15CF105. Burns waives further reading of the complaints, requests PH on CF cases and enters NG pleas to 15CM108. Court accepts pleas on 15CM108 and all three matters will track together for scheduling purposes. Court continues bond on 15CM108 and on 15CF62. State - bond on 15CF105 - $2000 cash bond. Burns - bond on 15CF105 - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - asks for no contact with Mickey Frank Jr. Stone states she is on a probation hold. Court - 15CF105 - $1000.00 cash bond. Court sets CF cases for PH.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
no consumption of aclohol-must appear 7/15/15 at 9:00 am
